text: Can I define the field which is shown in the parent listing from repeater children? By default it shows the value of the first child field. Most of the times I can change the order of the child fields but not always.

thanks. yeah i was able to do it with a 3 choice field. But i have seen a widget that looks like a standard alignment selector. It also has a reset button once you have made a choice. I feel it’s more intuitive for an editor than making a “choice” from a select list.
Understood. Currently we don't have a way for developers to create fields like that. I will pass along this feedback.
awesome thanks. i appreciate you taking the time to answer!
how about this. Where is the default “Image” module stored? If i could clone that I could get what i am after.
i don’t see it in any of the themes
it uses the styles tab to add in the align widget
Inside the `@HubSpot` folder. Not inside one of the default themes
doh! sorry it’s called linked_image i was looking between h and j sorry dude!
is that the base image module? gosh sorry for all the q’s
Yes, I believe it is now. In the past they were separate.
basically just trying to find an example of how a module can add that styles tab. It’s not in the linked_image module.
i assume it’s a global thing
You can’t currently add a styles tab
i think what you might want is sorting_label_field?
gotcha. well at least i can stop chasing my tail :wink:

It’s something we’re investigating but want to ensure we encourage best practices so that content creators don’t have confusing UI’s. Example - if you could put content in the style tab, it wouldn’t be styling, and would result in content creator’s being confused
absolutely. I have 11 years of drupal experience so i know all about confusing UI’s
thanks! I kinda assumed it would be for sorting and didn't even check.. :flushed:
